task.title: Security Groups landing page
task.shortdesc: The Security Groups landing page allows you to view, create, modify and delete security groups. You can delete multiple security groups at one time by checking the boxes next to the security groups you want to delete. Use the scroll bar to view additional security groups not in the browser's current view.

taskbody.prereq: To access this page from the dashboard, click Security groups from the left navigation bar under NETWORK & SECURITY or click the shield icon from the Security groups tile:

step.cmd: From the dashboard, locate the Security groups tile and click Create security group.
From the Security groups landing page, click the CREATE NEW SECURITY GROUP button near the top of the page.

taskbody.result:
The Create new security group page opens.
For additional information on completing that page, refer to the instructions provided in its Help content.

task.title: Viewing Details of a Security Group
task.shortdesc: You can expand a security group in the list to see details about the security group, including tags and rules associated with the security group.

step.cmd: Click the name of the security group in the list of security groups.
In the Actions column, click the action icon (･･･) for the security group you want to view and select View details.

taskbody.result: The details page for the selected security group opens.

task.title: Actions
task.shortdesc: Two Action buttons are available from the Security group landing page:

step.cmd: The More Actions button above the list of security groups has a context menu that allow you to apply an action to a particular security group or multiple security groups.

substep.cmd: Select one security group and both the View details and the Delete options are available.
Select multiple security groups from the list and only the Delete option is available.

step.cmd: Click the action icon (･･･) from the Actions column of a corresponding entry in the security group list, and the following action(s) can be performed:

substep.cmd: View details. Displays more information about the selected security group.
Delete security group. Removes the selected security group upon confirming the deletion.
